snippet: A credit bubble in fast-growing economies could burst, a report said, putting American mutual funds and other global investors in danger.
abstract: International Monetary Fund warns that American mutual fund investors with significant exposure to bonds issued by indebted companies in fast-growing economies like Brazil, China, Russia and Turkey may be at risk; report comes as fears mount about emerging markets.
lead_paragraph: A credit bubble in fast-growing economies could burst, a report said, putting American mutual funds and other global investors in danger.

headline.main: I.M.F. Warns of Risk From Emerging-Market Corporate Debt
headline.print_headline: I.M.F. Warns of Risk From Emerging-Market Corporate Debt
